isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - ELECTRONIC ENGINES, CUMMINS M11E AND N14E - OPERATION - IDLE SHUTDOWN FEATURE

svcproc.title: IDLE SHUTDOWN FEATURE
svcproc.para: Idle shutdown is a customer selectable feature. It can be enabled using Electronic Service Tools. If enabled, this feature will automatically shut the engine off after a customer selected period of time. If road speed equals 0 mph and idle shutdown is enabled, then the shutdown timer will be started, even if the brake, clutch, or throttle pedal are depressed.
If activity occurs in the brake, clutch, or throttle pedal, the idle shutdown timer will reset and restart.

If idle shutdown is activated for the PTO mode, the engine will shut down after the specified amount of time while in PTO. If the customer selected idle shutdown to be deactivated in the PTO mode, then the engine will not shut down while in PTO mode.
